resources.string: FluVille
FluVille Weekly News
CDC Information Feeds

Welcome to FluVille!
As the mayor of FluVille, your job
is to keep your residents healthly
and reduce the spread of the flu
throughout the population.
Use the controls on the right side of\nthe screen to keep the spread of the\nflu contained.
CDC recommends a yearly flu vaccine as the first\nand most important step in protecting\nagainst flu viruses.
Tap on a resident to immunize them.\nThey will be enclosed in a green bubble to\nidentify that they are safe from infection.
Washing your hands often will help\nprotect you from germs. If soap and water are not\navailable, use an alcohol-based hand rub.

Tap on a resident to provide them with
hand sanitizer. Hand sanitizer protects them for
12 hours represented by a number to
the left of the resident.

Germs are often spread when a person
touches something that is contaminated
with germs and then touches his
or her eyes, nose, or mouth.
Tap a contaminated building\nto clean the building and reduce the chance of\ninfections within that building.

If possible, stay home from work, school, and
errands when you are sick.
You will help prevent those around you
from getting sick.

Tap on a resident to send them home and keep
them from infecting other residents on
the streets, in their work place, or in the school.
Infected residents will stay home for
the rest of the day. Non-infected residents
will go back to work.

Infected Resident!

People with flu can spread it to
others up to about 6 feet away.
Flu carriers are contagious from one day
before showing symptoms to 5-7 days after infection.
Infected residents are enclosed in a red bubble to
identify that they are contagious.

Make sure that residents around the infected
resident are immunized or
have been given hand sanitizer.
Send the infected resident home as
soon as possible.

Infected Building!

When an infected resident reaches their destination
the destination building becomes infected.
All residents that are in the building or
enter the building at that point
become infected unless immunized or protected
with hand sanitizer.

Select the cleaning bucket and sponge control
and tap a contaminated building to clean the
building and reduce the chance of
infections within that building.
The flu vaccine and hand sanitizer are rationed out\nand renewed on a daily basis for hand sanitizer\nand every other day for the vaccine.
CDC News feeds are now available. Tap on one of the flyers above or use the menu button to browse the feeds.
Would you like to skip any information messages that you\'ve already seen?

Any data manipulations, representations, and/or stated or implied conclusions included in such applications or web sites have not been reviewed, confirmed or approved by the CDC for scientific accuracy.
